newsitem.title: PANAMA: Hutchison expects to win Panama ports contract.
newsitem.headline: Hutchison expects to win Panama ports contract.

text.p: A Panamanian unit of Hutchison Whampoa Ltd expects to be awarded a contract Tuesday to operate Panama's two main ports, an official of the Hong Kong-based consortium said.
"We're signing the contract today. We got all the final bits sorted out yesterday," said an official, who declined to be named.
"We can't comment until it's gone through all the ministries," the official said.
Panama's cabinet is expected to approve the contract Wednesday. Once approved, Hutchison would take over operations of the ports on February 1.
The Hong Kong group made a $22.2 million offer to operate the Cristobal port on the Atlantic coast and the Balboa port on the Pacific.
Cristobal and Balboa -- the Panama Canal's points of entry -- handle 200,000 and 28,000 cargo containers a year, respectively.
The United States is scheduled to turn over the ports to Panama next year.
